Key Match Events: The D-backs scored six runs in the final two innings, making Texas manager Bruce Bochy use his closer, José Leclerc.
The Rangers scored five runs in the second and five in the third to go up 10-0 before the D-backs had even batted around.
Pre-Game Insights: The D-backs have played with their backs against the wall plenty of times this year, including the last month of the season and the NLCS.
They have to find a way to win three straight against a Rangers team that is 10-0 on the road this postseason and has a potent offense.
Post-Match Reflections: Tommy Pham said the team's mood is down after the loss, but they can try to win every game now.
Paul Sewald said they have to play as loose as they can and try to take it one inning at a time.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The D-backs have all of their leverage pitchers rested and ready to go for Game 5, and they have ace Zac Gallen on the mound.
The Rangers have a potent offense despite losing one of their top hitters, Adolis García, to injury.
Others: In all best-of-seven postseason series, teams holding a 3-1 edge have gone on to win the series 78 of 92 times (85%).
The most recent team to rally from 3-1 down was Corey Seager’s 2020 Dodgers, against the Braves in the NL Championship Series.
